title: Access Items
text: You cannot access items in a set by referring to an index or a key.

But you can loop through the set items using a for 
loop, or ask if a specified value is present in a set, by using the
in keyword.

Example
Loop through the set, and print the values:

  thisset = {"apple", "banana", "cherry"}for x in thisset:  print(x)
Try it Yourself »

Example
Check if "banana" is present in the set:

  thisset = {"apple", "banana", "cherry"}print("banana" 
  in thisset)
Try it Yourself »

Example
Check if "banana" is NOT present in the set:

  thisset = {"apple", "banana", "cherry"}print("banana" 
  not in thisset)
Try it Yourself »

title: Change Items
text: Once a set is created, you cannot change its items, but you can add new items.
